TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Store : IDisposable, SemWeb.ModifiableSource, SemWeb.SelectableSource

Docs.summary: Clears the contents of the store.
Docs.remarks: The store is empty after a call to Clear.

Docs.param: The type of entities to return.
Docs.summary: Returns an array of all entities in the store whose type is known to be the given type.
Docs.returns: An array of all entities in the store whose type is known to be the given type.
Docs.remarks: Types are indicated using the rdf:type predicate.

Docs.param: The statement to add.
Docs.summary: Adds a statement to the store.
Docs.remarks: The Subject, Predicate, Object, and Meta fields of the statement must not be .

Docs.param: A statement or statement template to remove from the store.
Docs.summary: Removes statements from the store.

Docs.param: The source whose statements will be added into the store.
Docs.summary: Loads the contents of a StatementSource into the store.

Docs.param: The statement to search for, or a statement template.
Docs.summary: Returns whether the store contains a statement, or any statement that matches the template.
Docs.returns: if the store contains the statement or any statement matching the template.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Select (SemWeb.Statement template, SemWeb.StatementSink result);

Docs.param: A statement template. Use to select all statements in the store, or a statement with fields to select statements that match the non- parts of the statement.
A StatementSink to which each matching statement will be added.
Docs.summary: Queries the story for matching statements, and writes the statements to a .

MemberSignature.Value: public SemWeb.Resource[] SelectObjects (SemWeb.Entity subject, SemWeb.Entity predicate);

Docs.param: The subject of the statements to query.
The predicate of the statements to query.
Docs.summary: Finds all objects in statements with the given subject and predicate.
Docs.returns: An array of the entities found as the object of the matching statements, excluding literal values. An entity occurs in the array at most once.

block.para: This method is not recommended when the store can contain a large number of statements, as every matching entity must be loaded into memory before this method returns.

MemberSignature.Value: public SemWeb.Entity[] SelectSubjects (SemWeb.Entity predicate, SemWeb.Resource object);

Docs.param: The predicate of the statements to query.
The object of the statements to query.
Docs.summary: Finds all subjects in statements with the given predicate and object.
Docs.returns: An array of the entities found as the subject of the matching statements. An entity occurs in the array at most once.

block.para: This method is not recommended when the store can contain a large number of statements, as every matching entity must be loaded into memory before this method returns.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of statements in the store.
Docs.value: The number of statements in the store.

Docs.param: The stream to which statements are sent.
Docs.summary: Writes the contents of the store to a stream in N3 format.
Returns an array of all entities mentioned in the store.
Docs.returns: An array of all entities mentioned in the store.

Docs.summary: Returns an array of all predicates mentioned in the store.
Docs.returns: An array of all predicates mentioned in the store.

Docs.param: The resource from which the cached information is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Used by Store implementations to retrieve cached information in an entity.
Docs.returns: The object previously cached with by a call to , or if no resource key was set.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void SetResourceKey (SemWeb.Resource resource, object value);

Docs.param: The resource onto which the data is kept.
Data to be associated with the resource.
Docs.summary: Used by Store implementations to cache information with the entity.
Docs.remarks: is stored in a Hashtable within . To retreive the value later, use .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Replace (SemWeb.Entity find, SemWeb.Entity replacement);

Docs.param: The Entity to search for in the store.
The Entity to replace .
Docs.summary: Replaces all occurences of one Entity with another Entity.
Docs.remarks: All occurences of in statements in the store are replaced with references to .

Docs.summary: The protected no-arg constructor used by inherited classes.

Docs.param: A specifier string, whose format is given below.
Docs.summary: Creates a store from which statements will be read.
Docs.returns: A StatementSource from which statements can be read. An or is returned. Cast the value to when appropriate.

remarks.para: The specifier string is in one of the following formats. When a filename is expected, a dash can be used to indicate standard input.

item.description: A to read the RDF/XML file. Example: "xml:mydata.rdf"
A to read the N3/Turtle/NTriples file. Example: "n3:mydata.n3"

description.para: A connected to the SQLite database given in the connection string, using the tables prefixed by the table parameter. The returned store can be both read from and written to, despite the name of this method. Example: "sqlite:rdf:Uri=file:mydatabase.sqlite;Version=3"

item.description: A connected to the MySQL database given in the connection string, using the tables prefixed by the table parameter. The returned store can be both read from and written to, despite the name of this method. Example: "mysql:rdf:Database=databasename;Server=localhost;User Id=username"

A connected to the PostgreSQL database given in the connection string, using the tables prefixed by the table parameter. The returned store can be both read from and written to, despite the name of this method. Example: "postgresql:rdf:Server=localhost;Port=5432;Database=SemanticWeb;User Id=user"
A , which accesses a remote data source using the SPARQL Protocol. Example: "sparql-http:http://www.govtrack.us/sparql"

remarks.para: The SQL stores can be both read from and written to.

Docs.param: A specification string whose format is given below.
Docs.summary: Creates a into which statements will be added.
Docs.returns: A StatementSink. An or is returned. Cast the value to when appropriate.

remarks.para: The specifier string is in one of the following formats. When a filename is expected, a dash can be used to indicate standard output.

item.description: A opened on the given file. Example: "xml:mydata.rdf"
A opened on the given file, writing in the indicated format. Example: "turtle:mydata.turtle"
For Sqlite, MySQL, and PostgreSQL-based stores, use the spec string described in . These stores can be both read from and written to.

Docs.param: A statement template. Use to select all statements in the store, or a statement with fields to select statements that match the non- parts of the statement.
Docs.summary: Retuns a object that represents the result of matching a statement template against the store.

remarks.para: On calling this method, the data in this store is not immediately accessed. The matching statements are loaded the first time they are requested through the returned object. Those statements are accessed in one of three ways:
implements , so the result object can be used in loops, shown in this example:

The drawback of this method is that all of the matching statements are loaded into memory before the loop begins, and so this method is not recommended when the number of matching statements may be very large.

The method loads all of the matching statements into a . The MemoryStore can then be used to perform further Selects, or to get the matching statements as an array. This method is not advised when the number of matching statements may be very large.
implements , and the method on the returned object will stream the matching statements directly from this store to the provided without keeping the statements in memory.

is a statement template, which means any field in may be , and those fields are excluded from the statement filter. For example, setting the Subject and Predicate fields but leaving the Object and Meta fields will match all statements in the store that have the given Subject and Predicate, and anything in their Object and Meta fields.

Docs.param: The destination for the statements in this store.
Docs.summary: Streams all statements in this store into a StatementSink.
Docs.remarks: The method is called on for each statement in this store.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Replace (SemWeb.Statement find, SemWeb.Statement replacement);

Docs.param: The statement to find. This parameter must be a complete statement (with subject, predicate, and object non-null), not a template.
The statement that will replace the first statement.
Docs.summary: Replaces a single statement with another statement.
Docs.remarks: Store implementations may choose to optimize this method over a call to Remove followed by Add.

Docs.summary: Returns an array of all entities used in the Meta field of any statement in the store.
Docs.returns: An array of entities used in the Meta field of statements in the store.

Docs.param: An array of statement templates. Statement templates may contain a subject, predicate, object, and/or meta.
Docs.summary: Removes all statements matching an array of templates.
Closes the store.
Docs.remarks: Stores may release external resources or close remote connections in this method. Users of the Store class should Close stores when they are finished being used.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool DefaultContains (SemWeb.SelectableSource source, SemWeb.Statement template);

Docs.param: A data source.
A statement template to match against the source.
Docs.summary: A default implementation of the Contains operation for implementors of SelectableSource.
Docs.returns: Whether any statements in the source match the template.
Docs.remarks: This method is intended to be used by implementors of SelectableSource.

Docs.summary: Gets whether the store returns only distinct statments from Select calls.
Docs.value: True if any call to Select and its overloads yields only distinct statements (i.e. no duplicates).
Docs.remarks: When this property returns false, callers of Select may want to ensure the resulting statements have no duplicates. It this property returns true, such a check is unnecessary.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Select (SemWeb.SelectFilter filter, SemWeb.StatementSink result);

Docs.param: A filter specifying what statements to return.
A StatementSink to which each matching statement will be added.
Docs.summary: Queries the story for matching statements, with advanced options, and writes the statements to a .

Docs.param: A filter specifying what statements to return.
Docs.summary: Retuns a object that represents the result of the corresponding select call with a StatementSink.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DefaultSelect (SemWeb.SelectableSource source, SemWeb.SelectFilter filter, SemWeb.StatementSink sink);

Docs.param: The source to query.
The select filter to query with.
The result sink to send matching statements to.
Docs.summary: This method provides a default implementation of the Select method that takes a SelectFilter argument.
Docs.remarks: This method is intended to be used by subclasses of Store that do not want to provide their own implementation of Select with a SelectFilter.

Docs.param: A Resource (entity, literal, or bnode).
Docs.summary: Tests whether the store contains any statements that mention the given resource.
Docs.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the store contains any statements mentioning the resource.

Docs.summary: A repository for s.
Docs.remarks: This class is abstract. The maintains an in-memory array of statements. Other stores are available in the namespace.
